description.p: This farming tool has been dangerously refitted to serve as a killing edge on the battlefield. This weapon can only be effectively wielded with two hands.
On a hit, it deals 2d6 slashing damage.

You may also attack with the point of the scythe instead of the blade. the scythe does 2d4 piercing damage. On a critical hit, a scythe instead deals 8d4 piercing damage. This weapon will critically hit on a 19 or 20.

Rather than deal 2d6 slashing damage with its blade, you can attempt to strike with the scythe's point to deal 2d4 piercing damage. This attack instead has a critical range of 19-20 (which can compound with similar effects) and deals 8d4 piercing damage on a critical hit rather than dealing double the weapon's damage roll.

It takes an Action to deploy or retrieve a hand cannon.

description.p: A portable version of the siege cannon. Even though most are mundane items on their own, the requirement of smokepowder to operate makes their construction quite a rare occurrence. A fire lance can be shot while held in both hands.

The DC of the spread shot is DC 8 + DEX mod + STR mod (max 0 (add only if negative)) while held. creatures take half as much damage on a success. The Attack modifier of single shot is DEX mod + STR mod (max 0 (add only if negative)). If you are proficient in siege weapons, add your proficiency to all DCs and Attacks made with these attacks.

You can also make melee attacks with the fire lance. It is a reach weapon which does 1d8 bludgeoning damage on a strike. If you are proficient with martial weapons or the lance, add your proficiency to all DCs and Attacks made with this attack.

After this weapon is fired, an Action is required to load it with ammunition and smokepowder. The hand cannon can be loaded by somebody other than its wielder. Damage and range is based on the loaded ammunition. A packet of smokepowder is good for two shots and its ammunition is usually a 1lbs iron ball or pouch of 500 ball bearings.
